reviews.review_msg: In 3 words: Human sleeping pill.  Very hard to understand, unorganized, and typical hard ass prof from the movies.  Don't take him if you don't have to, just buy the book and read it, you will learn more than spending a few hundred bucks on this prof.  He is extremely partisan about his views and not afraid to show it.

It was really more of a propaganda session than a class. Can be confusing at times. Not a very enjoyable experience for those of us who happen to not subscribe to the "We Love Neoliberalism" newsletter, or "Gordon Campbell Monthly".
i thought he was pretty interesting
I would never take a class with this prof at all times. I found he to be very arrogent and one sided in his views. Was often late for class.
A turn off
Way too awkward to talk to...
No Comments
Avoid at all costs! Incredibly boring, unprepared.
He wears nice suits.

Lealle Ruhl in my entire academic career has been by far the greatest professor I have had. She is intelligent, humorous, quick-witted, and everything you would want in a professor to make you feel engaged in a lecture. Highly recommended for any person who appreciates great debates and discourse in a lecture.
Gave me castration anxiety!
No Comments

I took a course with her in the summer of 2003 and I still have nightmares about her. If you have an abundance of testosterone functioning in you system, and even if you think you are a feminist, beware the impotent causing potential of Lealle Ruhl!!!
No Comments

Amazing energy, clarity and direction. For a male in a feminist class - her ease, humour and candor made class very interested - attended 90% of the time - because I really enjoyed the way she taught *highly recommended*
Best prof I've ever had!  Funny, witty, hot, briliant!!
Intelligent, witty, a joy to listen to. Wish that all profs were this great!
oh my god. brilliant. amazing.
Excellent class and helped open up my thinking.  She is really funny.

TAKE NOTES! She talks a lot but you gotta write it all down that's exactly whats on her exam. She is very helpful if you go talk to her. And she has passion...she can is worth taking a class for. BIGGEST TIP: TAKE NOTES and you will ACE the CLASS

Why does UBC end up with all our good profs? I was under the impression I was doing quite well in the course. He must not have liked my final paper (ended up with a c+ overall I think). Intelligent and useful person, but his gradeing schiem seemed arbitrary...

In my 5+ years of post-secondary education, I have never had a professor as good as Dr. Erickson. His lectures were brilliant and kept me glued to my seat the entire time. His ideas about the logic of the Shield of Achilles is fascinating. If you get a chance, take a class with this prof. You won't regret it!
Best prof I've ever had. He loves laughing at comments he makes during class. Dresses real snazzy and looks just like Malcolm X.
Best poli sci prof at sfu

He makes you work for your grade. When he says to read and re-read the material, then do it. The course content he specializes in is theoretical politics -- meaning that the stuff you learn isn't all so easy. Sure, he's disorganized while in lecture, but if you do the readings prior to the class, then you'll know what's going on without a doubt.

I came into this course with no interest in political philosophy, but she has made the course really interesting.  Lectures are actually fun, thought you are expected to participate.  If you say something, be prepared to defend it with real logic.  Your "gut" feeling will not cut it in this class.

Fuji Johnson doesn't lecture, her grading scale follows no logical guide lines and her mood swings are out of control... For the sake of SFU Fuji Johnson should be canned before she is granted tenure...  If you are taking political science at SFU avoid this professor at all costs.
She teaches Allan Bloom, and calls herself a feminist... she is perhaps the only elitist in the Poli. Sci. Department. She does not belong there. She does not mark objectively

She is definitely a nice person. However, take a class with her only if you are a woman. If you disagree with her, prepare not to get a mark over a B. She either gives  you an A- if she likes you, or a B if she doesn't. She is a feminist thinker and definitely shows it in her marking and thinking. I would never take a class with her again.

Id certainly take another class with David. He made theory sound fun! Great lecturer. Interesting take on democratic theory. Very clear about his expectations. Really wants his students to succeed. Very welcoming for questions. Quite accommodating. Overall, hes one of the best in the department.

David is such a great prof! He is friendly, funny and approachable. He ensures class is engaging and really makes the lectures engaging. He knows his stuff and encourages you to participate which is awesome!
